sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词都有"喊，叫"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: cry, shout, exclaim, roar, scream, shriek, yell, call
means: cry ： 一般指因恐惧、痛苦、惊奇等而喊叫。
shout ： 指有意识地高声喊叫，常用于提出警告、发命令或唤起注意等。
exclaim ： 多指因高兴、愤怒、痛苦、惊讶等突发感情而高声喊叫。
roar ： 指发出大而深沉的声音、吼叫或咆哮。
scream ： 指因恐具、快乐或痛苦而发出的尖叫声。
shriek ： 指因惊恐、痛苦等或其它感情而发出比scream更为尖锐、刺耳的叫声。
yell ： 多指求援、鼓励时的呼叫。也可指因外界因素刺激而发出尖厉声音。
call ： 指大声说话或喊叫，以引起某人的注意。

sentence.Network_en: Yours truly was awoken by a shout: "Ahoy there!"
sentence.Network_cn: 鄙人被一声大喊惊醒：“喂！”

sentence.Network_en: The driver managed to escape from the vehicle and shout a warning.
sentence.Network_cn: 那名司机设法从车里逃了出来并大声警告别人。

sentence.Network_en: A small group of youths stayed behind to heckle and shout abuse.
sentence.Network_cn: 一小群小青年没走，在起哄、叫骂。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)(of a contest) almost finished and therefore virtually decided
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)（比赛）快结束，胜负已成定局

lj.lj_ly: they were definitely in with a shout of bringing off a victory.
lj.lj_ls: 他们一定有绝佳机会取得成功的。

jx.jx_en_mean: talk about something openly and jubilantly, especially something that is personal or has previously been kept secret
jx.jx_cn_mean: 兴致勃勃地公开谈论（私事，曾经保守的秘密）

jx.jx_en_mean: To overwhelm or silence by shouting loudly.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 大叫使大家安静下来：通过高声喊叫压过或使…安静

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: perhaps related to shoot; compare with Old Norse skúta 'a taunt', also with the verb scout

encyclopedia.content: 百科名片 《Shout》为美国歌手迈克尔杰克逊的一首歌曲。 歌曲介绍 《Shout》这首歌是《Invincible》的备选歌曲，最终发行的《Invincible》专辑没有收录，录制于2000年左右吧，收录在少数地区才发行的《Cry》单曲中（Cry,Invincible中的歌曲）。此歌曲由Michael Jackson, T.Riley, Claude Forbes, Samuel Hoskins, Carmen Lampson, R.Hamilton共同创作。 《Shout》在最早决定的《Invincible》曲目里，但出于MJ自己的意愿，所以把它

entry.tran: (通常指生气时或希望远方的人能听见时而)大叫，嚷，高呼
entry.def: If you shout, you say something very loudly, usually because you want people a long distance away to hear you or because you are angry.

example.ex: He had to shout to make himself heard above the near gale-force wind...
example.tran: 在呼啸的大风中他得大声喊叫才能让别人听见。
“她还活着!”他欢欣鼓舞地大声叫道。

entry.tran: 成功在望;有成功的机会
entry.def: If you say that someone is in with a shout of achieving or winning something, you mean that they have a chance of achieving or winning it.

example.ex: He knew he was in with a shout of making Craig Brown's squad for Japan.
example.tran: 他明白自己有望为日本建成克雷格·布朗之队。

entry.def: If you are in a pub and someone you are with says 'It's your shout' or 'It's my shout', they mean that it is your turn or their turn to buy a round of drinks.

means.word_mean: 1. a loud utterance; often in protest or opposition;

sentences.sentence: "the speaker was interrupted by loud cries from the rear of the audience"

means.word_mean: 1. utter in a loud voice; talk in a loud voice (usually denoting characteristic manner of speaking);

sentences.sentence: "My grandmother is hard of hearing--you'll have to shout"
"she cried with pain when the doctor inserted the needle"
"I yelled to her from the window but she couldn't hear me"

means.word_mean: 3. utter aloud; often with surprise, horror, or joy;

sentences.sentence: "`I'm here,' the mother shouted when she saw her child looking lost"

means.word_mean: 4. use foul or abusive language towards;

sentences.sentence: "The actress abused the policeman who gave her a parking ticket"
"The angry mother shouted at the teacher"

auth_sentence.content: The judge got to shout triumphantly, objection overruled!
auth_sentence.res_content: The judge got to shout triumphantly, objection overruled!
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The judge got to shout triumphantly, objection overruled!

auth_sentence.content: Ideally, your eyes shouldn't shout false eyelashes.
auth_sentence.res_content: Ideally, your eyes shouldn't shout false eyelashes.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Ideally, your eyes shouldn't shout false eyelashes.

auth_sentence.content: I confront him and shout, Sir is Shabine!
auth_sentence.res_content: I confront him and shout, Sir is Shabine!
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I confront him and shout, Sir is Shabine!

Sentence.sentence: Shouting or acting rude will get you nowhere.
She isn't going to be shouted down by over-confident young gentlemen.

sentences.en: She shouted to attract their attention.
sentences.cn: 她大声叫嚷以引起他们的注意。

sentences.en: Suddenly Jack shouted that he had lost five pounds.
sentences.cn: 突然杰克大喊他丢失了五英镑。

sentences.en: They heard him give a loud shout of astonishment.
sentences.cn: 他们听见他惊奇地大叫一声。

sentences.en: What will you have?It's my shout today.
sentences.cn: 你要喝什么?今天我请客。

jushi.english: You can shout till the cows come home and you still won't be able to attract his attention.
jushi.chinese: 你可以一直不断地喊下去,可是依然不能引起他的注意。

jushi.english: I can hear you all right.There is no need to shout.
jushi.chinese: 我听得见你说话,用不着喊。

jushi.english: She shouted to attract their attention.
jushi.chinese: 她大声叫嚷以引起他们的注意。
